tables.name: valsi
tables.schema: ++id, bangu, w, y, d, n, t, *s, g, *r, *cache

rows.d: $x_{1}$ exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in property/amount $x_{4}$ (ka/ni).
rows.n: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per {ragve}); also not limited to position in space.  See also {dukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) defends/protects $x_{2}$ (object/state) from threat/peril/potential $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also secures (verb); $x_1$ wards/resists $x_3$; protective cover/shield (= {badgai}).  See also {ckape}, {fanta}, {fapro}, {marbi}, {rivbi}, {zunti}, {snura}, {binra}, {lunbe}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an amphibian of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}).  See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases.  See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.
rows.n: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}).  See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume.  See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks.  See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spherical object [made of $x_{2}$].
$x_{1}$ is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function $x_{2}$ in body of $x_{3}$; [metaphor: calcium].
rows.n: $x_2$ is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}).  See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$ with lid $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi.  See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is ready/prepared for $x_{2}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places).  ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a breeze/wind/gale from direction $x_{2}$ with speed $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ blows from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, subunits [e.g. ounces] $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is brown/tan [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a brush for purpose $x_{2}$ (event) with bristles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is embarrassed/disconcerted/flustered/ill-at-ease about/under conditions $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ is the direction of $x_{2}$ (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is towards $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= {selfa'a} for reordered places).  See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ develops/evolves towards/into $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ through stages $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
$x_{1}$ [sequence] is in reverse order from $x_{2}$ [sequence]; $x_{1}$ (object) is inverted from $x_{2}$ (object).
$x_{1}$ is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among $x_{2}$ with shares/portions $x_{3}$; ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ fa'u).
rows.n: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ boils/evaporates at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose $x_{2}$ with tines/prongs $x_{3}$ on base/support $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reacts/responds/answers with action $x_{2}$ to stimulus $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is responsive.
rows.n: $x_3$ stimulates $x_1$ into reaction $x_2$, $x_3$ stimulates reaction $x_2$ (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ forgives $x_{2}$ for event/state/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is easy/simple/facile for $x_{2}$ (agent) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ does $x_{1}$ freely/easily.
$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).
$x_{1}$ offers/proffers $x_{2}$ [offering] to $x_{3}$ with conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ frowns/grimaces (facial expression).
rows.n: $x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) guides/conducts/pilots/leads $x_{2}$ (active participants) in/at $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated.  See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a billion [British milliard] [$10^9$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}).  (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard $x_{2}$ (si'o) measuring property $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also grade, level, point; $x_3$ dimension.  See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is gray [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a fruit [body-part] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
rows.n: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
rows.n: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
rows.n: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
rows.n: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
rows.n: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
rows.n: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
rows.n: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
rows.n: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_2$ by storyteller $x_3$ to audience $x_4$.
rows.n: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author.  See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also roll, log.  ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
rows.n: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the liver [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fuel/energy-source for powering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}).  See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is bare/naked/nude; $x_{1}$ is without cover/clothes/[protection].
$x_{1}$ is Earth's moon (default); $x_{1}$ is a major natural satellite/moon of planet $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
rows.n: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
rows.n: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
rows.n: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the side of/lateral to $x_{2}$ and facing $x_{3}$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (cf. {crane}, {trixe}, {pritu}, {zunle} which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side.  The $x_4$ of mlana may be either the front, or back side of $x_2$, {korbi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also negative (= {nonme'a}).  See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain $x_{2}$ parasitic/growing on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a satellite/moon orbiting $x_{2}$ with characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ mails/posts [transfer via intermediary service] $x_{2}$ to recipient address $x_{3}$ from mailbox/post office/sender address $x_{4}$ by carrier/network/system $x_{5}$.
rows.n: Also $x_4$ post office, mailbox.  (cf. {benji} [in which the medium need not be a 3rd party service/system, and $x_2$ need not consist of discrete units], {notci}, {xatra}, {tcana})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [tool] is a hammer for/hammers $x_{2}$ [target] consisting of weight/head $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is immaterial/not physical/without material form.
$x_{1}$ is a boy/lad [young male person] of age $x_{2}$ immature by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba).  See also {nixli}, {verba}, {nanmu}, {bersa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a man/men; $x_{1}$ is a male humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu).  See also {ninmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nanla}, {bersa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a billionth/thousand-millionth [$10^{-9}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a nut [body-part: hard-shelled fruit] from plant/species $x_{2}$ with shell $x_{3}$ and kernel $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_4$ nucleus, center (= {velnarge} for place reordering).  See also {grute}, {stagi}, {jbari}, {midju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is orange [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates $x_{2}$ (du'u) under rules/logic $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also exception (= {nafmupli}); agentive contradict/deny (= {nafxu'a} or {tolxu'a}).  See also {nibli}, {tugni}, {zanru}, {xusra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a nation/ethnic group of peoples $x_{2}$; [people sharing a history/culture].
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of noble gas of type $x_2$ [helium/neon/argon/krypton/xenon/radon].
$x_{1}$ is a canal/channel to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is the nose [body-part] of $x_{2}$ with nostril(s)/nasal passage(s) $x_{3}$; [metaphor: protrusion].
$x_{1}$ is energy of type $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is fond of/likes/has a taste for $x_{2}$ (object/state).
$x_{1}$ is in/inside/within $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is on the inside/interior of $x_{2}$ [totally within the bounds of $x_{2}$].
rows.n: Indicates total containment.  (cf. se {vasru} (for containment that need not be total), {jbini}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {sruri}, {senta}, {snuji}, {bartu}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {jinru}, {setca})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state $x_{2}$ under rules/logic system $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nighttime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is at night/nocturnal.
rows.n: Tonight (= {cabycte}); tomorrow night (= {bavlamcte}, even when tonight is still in the future); last night (= {prulamcte}).  See also {donri}, {djedi}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel/other metal resistant to oxidation.
$x_{1}$ [furniture items] furnishes $x_{2}$ [location] serving purpose/function $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a message/notice/memorandum about subject $x_{2}$ from author $x_{3}$ to intended audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Emphasis on brevity, single or identifiable subject (contrast with xatra: the emphasis in notci is on the single or cohesively focused subject, while the audience is less defined - indeed only an 'intended' audience.  xatra need not have a single or focussed subject - its corresponding place is for 'content'); reminder/memo/note (= {mojnoi}).  See also {xatra}, {nuzba}, {mrilu}, {morji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is magenta/fuchsia/purplish-red [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is an apple [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a plane [2-dimensional shape/form] defined by points $x_{2}$ (set); $x_{1}$ is flat/[smooth].
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is even/planar/level.  ($x_2$ is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); See also {xutla}, {sefta}, {tapla}, {karda}, {boxfo}, {pinta}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] $x_{2}$ with tool $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a route/path/way/course/track to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via/defined by points including $x_4$ (set).
rows.n: A route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; ($x_4$ is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  (cf. {litru}, {naxle}, {tcana}, {dargu}, {klaji}, ve {klama}; {tadji}, {zukte} for means to a goal, {klama}, {pagre})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (force) folds/creases $x_{2}$ at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in $x_3$, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds.  See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $x_{2}$ on unordered set $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is serial.  (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.

rows.d: (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is elastic/springy.
$x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.
$x_{1}$ is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from $x_{2}$ in medium/on surface $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a police officer/[enforcer/vigilante] enforcing law(s)/rule(s)/order $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Police officer, as an agent of authority (= {ca'irpulji}, {ka'irpulji}), as part of a police force (= {puljysoi}, as part of {puljyselsoi}); military police (= {jempulji}, {bilpulji}).  See also {catni}, {sonci}, {bilni}, {flalu}, {bandu}, {jemna}, {zekri}, {krati}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of bronze of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is soft/malleable/moldable/yielding to force $x_{2}$ in conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is ironic(al)/contrary to expectation $x_{2}$ in state/property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [action] repeats/is repeated for a total of $x_{2}$ (quantity) occurrences.
$x_{1}$ is natural/spontaneous/instinctive, not [consciously] caused by person(s).
$x_{1}$ is a rat of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an atom of element/atomic number $x_{2}$ of isotope number/atomic weight $x_{3}$.
rows.n: (cf. {kantu} for a basic unit of a property or activity; {selci} for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a river of land mass $x_{2}$, draining watershed $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$/terminating at $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of rice [a type of grain] of strain/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the heart [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral].
$x_{1}$ is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal $x_{2}$, by custom/in community $x_{3}$, with form/rules $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ is formal, Legal.  $x_1$ is 'going through the motions']; $x_4$ constraints/customs; See also {lijda}, {malsi}, {flalu}, {javni}, {tcaci}, {clite}, {junri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ avoids/evades/shuns/escapes/skirts [fate] $x_{2}$ (event) through action/state $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also detours around, stays away from; ($x_1$ is normally an object, but may be an event).  See also bandu which is not necessarily successful, {fanta}, which is agentive, se jersi which implies an opposing agent, {sisku}, {kalte}, {fapro}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an indivisible, most basic subunit of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ generally has mass nature); (cf. {kantu} for properties, activities; {ratni}, {gradu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) serves $x_{2}$ with service $x_{3}$ (activity); $x_{1}$ is a servant (noun) of $x_{2}$ performing $x_{3}$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'e} - alertness
{a'enai} - exhaustion.

attitudinal: 
{a'i} - effort
{a'icu'i} - no special effort
{a'inai} - repose.

attitudinal: 
{ai} - intent
{aicu'i} - indecision
{ainai} - rejection/refusal.

attitudinal: 
{a'o} - hope
{a'onai} - despair.
interval event contour: in the aftermath of ...; since ...; retrospective/perfect              |     |----.

discursive: 
{ba'u} - exaggeration
{ba'ucu'i} - accuracy
{ba'unai} - understatement.
{bangu} modal, 1st place                            in language ...
sumti link to attach sumti (default $x_{2}$) to a selbri; used in descriptions.
location tense relation/direction; north of.
elidable terminator: terminate numeral or letteral string.
convert any single word to BY.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 1.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 2.
logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 3.

attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o} - start emotion
{bu'ocu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'onai} - end emotion.
non-logical connective: respectively; unmixed ordered distributed association.
{fasnu} modal, 1st place (non-causal)               in the event of ...
sumti place tag: tag 2nd sumti place.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #9 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #10 (specified by goi).
sumti place tag: tag 5th sumti place.
reverse Polish mathematical expression (mex) operator flag.
begin indicator long scope.

attitudinal modifier: 
{fu'i} - easy
{fu'inai} - difficult.
end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
closed interval bracket marker; mod. intervals in non-logical connectives; include boundaries.
location tense relation/direction; upwards/up from ...
{gasnu} modal, 1st place agent/actor case tag       with active agent ...
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal and (with gi).
elidable terminator: end GOI relative phrases; usually elidable in non-complex phrases.
logical connective: all but tanru-internal forethought connective medial marker.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought or.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought and.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought conn question.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru internal biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if(with gi).
pro-bridi: repeats a recent bridi (usually not the last 2).
pro-bridi: repeats the next to last bridi.
pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.
sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.
rows.n: Note: Directionality of assignment may be ambiguous. {ca'e} on the "toward" side may be used to disambiguate.

rows.d: pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.
pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.

discursive: 
{la'a} - probability
{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
{klesi} modal, 1st place (scalar set)               in/of category ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
descriptor: the one, which (is / does) ... / those, which (are / do) ...
rows.n: Terminated with {ku}. Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

rows.d: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
{marji} modal, 1st place                            material in object/substance ...
{manri} modal, 1st place (by standard 2)            in reference frame ...
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.
{zmadu} modal, 1st place (a greater)                exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
{mleca} modal, 1st place (a lesser)                 undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
digit/number: less than.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

rows.d: the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.

{mi'enai} - denial of identity; identifies speaker.

$x_1$ is an omnibus for carrying $x_2$ in medium $x_3$ propelled by $x_4$.

rows.d: $x_1$ will happen in $x_2$ length of time; $x_1$ will happen $x_2$ length of time after $x_3$

rows.n: Not just vocal cheering. See also: ".{ui'o}".

rows.d: $x_1$ is a buddha of type/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a $x_2$osity, a $x_2$onger, an absolute $x_2$ I tell you (augmentative)
$x_1$ is ugly to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$

$x_1$ is a glyph, elemental symbol within an agreed set of symbols, intended to represent character $x_2$
rows.n: Glyphs are used for the purposes of writing, expressing thoughts, ideas and concepts. See also {lerfu}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a gloss (brief explanatory note or translation) of $x_2$ (text)
$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the Mediterranean region/culture/geography/identity/[nationality] in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is the graph on vertices/nodes $x_2$ (set) and edges $x_3$ (set of ordered or unordered 2-tuples of vertices in $x_2$) and with additional properties $x_4$.
rows.n: A "web"/"network". An element of x2 is a "place" in a more generic/abstract/metaphoric sense than spatial; must be discrete. Thus, webpages, family diagrams, lattices, pages in a book, cities and roadways on a map, etc. constitute graphs. x1 also includes trees. Notice that both x2 and x3 are sets; a member of x3 is a 2-tuple, but the order matters iff x1 is oriented - in which case, the edge connects from the first node in the tuple to the second node in the tuple. x4 can include defining features, weights, etc. Equivalent to {grafetu} (which is merely the fu'ivla form of this word); very similar to {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_1$ pertains/is related to/reflects (the) gravitational interaction [fundamental]/gravity in manner/with properties/in state/with realization $x_2$, coupling to $x_3$ in manner/with strength $x_4$
$x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$

$x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$
rows.n: This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.

rows.d: $x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition)
$x_1$ is old/aged [relatively long in elapsed duration] by standard $x_2$
$x_1$ is a lamp/candle/torch with fuel/power source $x_2$
rows.n: Refers to any artificial light source, whether flammable or electric. For "electric lamp," see {diclamdu}. See also {lanru}, {gusni}, {livla}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
rows.n: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the home galaxy (default: Milky Way) of object/group/entity/race/vel sim. $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the ISO-named language of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ pertains to Loglan language/culture in aspect $x_2$

$x_1$ is/pertains to/reflects some version of Loglan or Lojban, or the derivatives thereof (or any language, project, thing which is path-connected thereto by derivation), in aspect/property $x_2$ (ka).
rows.n: Not necessarily any logical language, but ones which are inspired by or based on Loglan or Lojban. This word is meant to make it so that "{loglo}"'s semantic scope can be narrowed so as to refer to Loglan, as opposed to/exclusive of Lojban and others; and likewise for "{lojbo}". See also: "{gaspo}".

rows.d: $x_1$ is a crustacean of order/family $x_2$
$x_1$ is electric [adjective] producing electric field $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a microrganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a kitteh of type/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
rows.n: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of mango. {ricrmango} for mango tree.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
rows.n: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is magnetism/magnetization (or magnetic charge or magnetic current; or part of a magnetic dipole) in/on/of/produced by $x_2$ (monopole or a dipole, taken in whole or just as a single side/part/pole thereof) of polarity/quantity $x_3$ (default: positive, which indicates magnetic-south in English)
rows.n: If the signum of $x_3$ is positive, then the charge being referred to is what English speakers call "magnetic-south (pole)"; if it is negative, then the referent is what English speakers call "magnetic-north (pole)". This definition is modelled on that of {dikca}. If one does not prefer this gismu, one probably can use "{maktcaxe}" as an equivalent/synonym, but that word uses another experimental gismu ("{tcaxe}") in its veljvo.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
rows.n: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is a meme (memetic information/characteristic/aspect) of culture, school of thought (broadly defined), item/phenomenon, vel sim. $x_2$, determining trait/process/property $x_3$.
rows.n: Broadly construed. Definition analogous to that of "{jgina}". No implication of fitness or virality/spread. See also: "{sidbo}", "{sibvidru}".

rows.d: $x_1$ (li; number) is congruent to $x_2$ (li; number; see description for canonical/traditional/contextless default usage) modulo $x_3$ (li; number); $\frac{(x_1 - x_2)}{x_3}$ is an integer.
rows.n: In order to be clear (in case of poor display), ($x_1$ - $x_2$)/$x_3$ is an integer, possibly (but not necessarily) nonpositive. Traditionally, but not necessarily, $x_3$ is a strictly positive integer (in particular, $x_3$ is nonzero) and is called "(the) modulus"; if $x_3 = 1$, then $x_1$ and $x_2$ differ only by an integer amount - in other words, they have the same fractional part. Technically, $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric under mutual exchange and can even be equivalent; however, in a manner morally analogous to "{srana}", $x_2$ is canonically/traditionally either the common residue (the unique element in the space which is congruent to $x_1$ mod $x_3$ and which is greater than or equal to 0 and strictly less than $x_3$) or the minimal residue (denoting the common residue by $c$, the minimal residue is either $c$ xor $c - x_3$, whichever is strictly less than the other in absolute value), and this may even be considered as its contextless default meaning (such as in "lo se modju"). See also: {dilcu}, {dunli}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {panra}, {dilma} (a particularly close relative and generalization of this word with slightly different focus). This word is essentially identical with {dilcrmadjulu}; consider this word to be its gismu equivalent. It is not the modulus operator; for that, use {veldilcu}. It is a specific type of {terpanryziltolju'i}, although both occupy the word "modulo" in English.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a Muggle/an outsider/a foreigner/uninitiated to group/community $x_2$ (default {jbopre})
$x_1$ is a nerd/geek (demonstrates esoteric intense interests at the cost of social acceptance) according to standard/within culture $x_2$ with nerdy/geeky interests $x_3$
rows.n: Modeled on the definition of {mugle}. Some degree of (at least budding) expertise might be implied, but it is not truly necessary. There just has to be a degree of social rejection or isolation and an intense interest about (a) narrow and somewhat obscure subject matter(s). A nerd need not always be socially disconnected, but it should happen at least where $x_3$ is involved or the interest becomes relevant/apparent. On the other hand, nerdiness/geekiness is also a personality (or a trait thereof), some sense, it never does not apply if it ever applies; but there are contexts wherein certain traits do not really emerge/reveal themselves readily. The intensity of interest in $x_3$ should be judged to be excessive and abnornal, to the point of social separation, by/relative to $x_2$.

rows.d: $x_1$ (vector) is the displacement of $x_2$ (object/point) relative to $x_3$ (object/point; contextless default: origin) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_4$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_5$
rows.n: x1 is (four-)vector-valued; it is a function that maps to a tensor (probably a vector or scalar) to a (four-)vector. Units are handled in x1, which will be a (four-)vector of {mitre} or the like. Time of measurement is just ca or the argument of the function(s) in x1, or can be defined instantaneously by x4. Proposed short rafsi: -nif-. See also: {nifkemtemsalri}.

rows.d: $x_1$ reflects Norwegian culture/nationality in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ are noodles made of $x_2$
$x_1$ is 1 [$1*10^0$] of $x_2$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$ (default is units).
rows.n: This is the null SI prefix, but it does not have a name in English or any truly official SI documentation; so, one meter is equal to one 'nulpa'-meter. {nulpa} = {kamre} {li} {pa}. See also: {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}, {kamre}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a non-binary-gendered humanoid person [not necessarily adult]
rows.n: Umbrella term for any non-man non-woman (in some aspect/consideration/standard) humanoid person. As such, it is a specification of {rempre}/{remna}/{prenu} co-equal with {ninmu} and {nanmu}; it generalized some of the aforementioned cases. Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; use instead {remna} or {prenu}. See also: {ninmu}, {nanmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {bersa}, {tixnu}, {paznu}, {nakni}, {fetsi}, {dinti}, {nanla}, {nixli}, {verba}, {vepre}

rows.d: $x_1$ orbits a (common) barycenter with $x_2$, with orbital characteristics/parameterz $x_3$.
rows.n: Typically but not necessarily, $x_2$ will be the more massive object (compared to $x_1$) unless the barycenter is outside of both bodies; nonetheless, this word is technically symmetric between $x_1$ and $x_2$ if no external force is being applied to the system or either body (causing a deviation from orbit). See also: "{mluni}". If "mluni" is strictly about objects which orbit planets or artificial objects which orbit stellar or smaller objects (if they orbit them at all), then this word is a generalization; it can reference such objects, or planets around their sun(s), or satellite galaxies, among others. If "mluni" has a definition which encompasses this one in terms of scope, then this one should probably be deleted.

rows.d: $x_1$ poses deflated and derided morally worthless, cheap, vulgar, commonplace, banal qualities according to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$
rows.n: $x_1$ poses poshlyi [Russian original term] morally worthless, cheap, sham, smutty, vulgar, common, commonplace, trivial, trite, banal qualities that are subject to being deflated and derided. $x_1$ is poshlyi / posljak  / posljacka / exposes poshlost' / poshlust. See {tartrpocli} for a non-experimental synonym.

rows.d: $x_1$ is poplar / aspen / cottonwood (plant of genus Populus) of species $x_2$

rows.d: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a linguistic-gesture unit/chereme [in analogy with phoneme; specifically, nonvocal] representing/that is recognized meaningful conceptual subunit underlying specific gestures/gesture-phones $s_2$ in language $b_1$ used by $b_2$ in order to communicate/express $b_3$=$c_2$ (si'o/du'u; not quote) made using body part/utensil/tool/locus $c_3$ by motion/action/means $c_4$
rows.n: From {bangu} {corci} (here non-vocal) {selci}. $x_2$ is a recognized/represented by (belongs to equivalence class of) chereme $x_1$. The chereme may not have meaning on its own but must be expressive naturally and/or in that language (as a gesture and phoneme is, respectively). See also {banvoksle}, {xancrcereme}, {lercorci}, {cocle'u}, {corci}, {xanle'u}, {xanle'ule'u}, {xanbau}, {saskrcereme}

rows.d: $g_1$ is a language-creation/conlanging society/group/club.
rows.n: Not necessarily collaborative. Some sort of group of individuals united by an interest in language creation. For the Language Creation Society, a nonprofit organization founded in 2007, see {banfingirz} (and, for more information, https://conlang.org).

$s_1$ is a/the batrachology/study of amphibians $b_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.

$x_1$ is a language with dialects $x_2$ (full set)

rows.n: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for languages: From gismu {bangu} and {srana}

rows.d: $p_1$ is a linguist (scientist).

$s_1$ (phone/speech sounds; specifically is linguistic and vocal) is a phoneme in/of segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2$=$v_1$ in language $b_1$ of speaker $v_2$=$b_2$ in order to communicate/express $b_3$ (si'o/du'u; not quote(?)), produced with body-parts/tools $x_6$ at loci/in position/manner (of articulation) $x_7$

Recognition of a phoneme as linguistically distinct is language-dependent; b1 is a language which includes/recognizes said phoneme (and which realizes/recognizes/categorizes/divides phones s2 into the equivalence class of that phoneme). x6 and x7 are not predictable from the veljvo.

rows.n: Omitted: x5 = klama2 (destination) = bartu1 (something external).  Cf. {bartu}, {klama}, {zevykla}, {barli'a}.

rows.n: An exonym is a name externally given to something or someone, especially a place, ethnic group or language. It is the opposite of an endonym, a self-given or internal name ({sezme'e} or {nerme'e}). For instance, "" is an exonym for the U.S.A., and "Navajo" is an exonym for the Din people.

$s_1$ is a split piece of language $b_1$=$s_2$.
$d_1$ desires/wants/wishes for future $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$ with desired future point $b_1$. $d_1$ aspires.
rows.n: b1 refers to the point in time when the aspiring individual wants the desire to come true; not the time they expect it to come true.

rows.d: $g_1$=$p_1$ thinks about/considers/ponders/reflects upon doing $b_1$=$g_2$=$p_2$ (nu) after $b_2$ (nu)
rows.n: I found that there was no good, single word for "thinking about doing ... after ...". (See {balvi}, {gasnu}, and {pensi})

rows.d: $x_1$ predicts that $x_2$ (du'u) is true in/about future time/place $x_3$ on grounds $x_4$.
rows.n: From {balvi} {jinvi}. Nearly synonymous with {la'erji'i}, {bavykri}. Related words: {kanpe}, {bavyxusra}, {bavyske}, {cfabalvi}, {tembalvi}, {selbalvi}, {ba'alvi}, {datru}, {temci}, {purci}, {cabna}, {uenai}, {ba'a}, {ba}.

rows.d: $b_1$=$l_1$ is next after $b_2$=$l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the next month; $m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the month following $b_2$=$l_2$, month standard $m_3$.
$c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow morning; $c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the morning after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $c_3$.
$n_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the night after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $n_3$.
rows.n: {cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. Cf. {nicte}, {prulamcte}, {bavlamdei}.

rows.d: $d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is tomorrow; $d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the day following $b_2$=$l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$j_1$=$b_1$ is the week directly after $b_2$ by standard $j_3$.
$x_1$ is the next/following time that $x_2$ happens.
$n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is next year; $n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the year following $b_2$=$l_2$ by year standard $n_3$.
$v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow evening; $v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the evening after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $v_3$.
$k_1$ is unable to/incapable of remembering future $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$. $k_1$ has anterograde amnesia/memory loss.
rows.n: Second place describes scope of loss. Cf. {mojnalka'e} {prumojnalka'e}

rows.d: $x_1$ is/are the latest, most forward in time among $x_2$
$x_1$ is futureward/to the futureward side/in the future of $x_2$ in frame of reference/according to observer or vantage point $x_3$.
rows.n: $x_1$ and $x_2$ probably should always be events ("{nu}"). This word is close to equivalent to "{balvi}"; a reasonable proposal would be to combine the two words, in analogy with spacial direction brivla; many, if not all, of the available glosses of one probably are shared with the other; minor connotational differences may exist. It means "more recent/more recent side (of event)" if $x_1$ is in the past. In a conceptual universe in which time is not oriented or in which there are multiple time dimensions, or perhaps if time is behaving exotically (such as with time-travel), $x_3$ can also be a "which faces" sumti slot, as in "{zunle}".

rows.d: $f_1$ ages / passes through time into future form $f_2 = b_1$ from current / past / earlier form $f_3 = b_2$ through stages $f_4$.
$x_1$ expects/anticipates $x_2$ to happen.
$p_1$ delays $p_2$ until after $b_2$.
$x_1$ is the future self/identity of $x_2$; $x_1$ is $x_2$ in the future.
rows.n: From {balvi} {sevzi}. $x_2$ is usually a person. Compare {cabyse'i}, {pruse'i}.

rows.d: $s_1$ is futurology/future studies of/about ideas of the future $b_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
rows.n: Science about the future, not to be confused with science in the future.

rows.d: $s_1$ is the fianc(e)/betrothed of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.

rows.n: Compare to {bavji'i}, {bavykri}, which both deal with thought predictions rather than predictions in speech/writing.

rows.n: Necessarily coupled to bank account(s) with withdrawable (positive) balance. See payment card ({lejykarda}), credit/charge card ({jitseldejykarda}/{detseldejykarda}) and stored-value card ({vamveile'ikarda}). Cf. {maksriveikarda}, {lejykardymi'i}, {banxa}, {pleji}, {jdini}.

Consider "I poisoned the cake for him" vs "I baked a cake for him" ("for him to eat" would be a purpose/goal). See also {be'ei}, {kosmu}, {terzu'e}, {selxau}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a rhythmic conjugation of word $x_2$, rhyming with word $x_3$ in language $x_4$, with changed final vowel/ending $x_5$.
rows.n: This word refers to the uncommon practice of changing the last vowel of a brivla in order to have it rhyme with surrounding words in its spoken context.  This can only be done to gismu and lujvo ending in 5-letter rafsi. x2 should be the orthodox spelling of x1.  Use "{me'o} [vowel]" to describe x5. This word is an autonym, being a {gimrafrimna} of the word {gimrafrimni}.  See also {rimni} {abu} {ebu} {ibu} {obu} {ubu} {sezyskivla}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a list of gismu
$x_1$ (si'o) deserves a gismu $x_2$ by standard $x_3$ according to $x_4$, over the objections of $x_5$, even though it would conflict with gismu $x_6$ and $x_7$ is a perfectly good zi'evla
$x_1$ is a stage 3 fu'ivla/zi'evla meaning $x_2$, based on gismu/root word $x_3$ in language $x_4$
$x_1$ is a chromosome containing gene/locus $x_2$ of species $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' ancestor of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.
rows.n: $x_2$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_1$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_1$; trivially, one may consider $x_1$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_1$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazyseldze}". This word allows familial peers as possibilities for $x_1$ and $x_2$, so this relationship is a subtype of {ginydze}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a genetic/biological/'blood' family member of $x_2$ via bonds/ties/standard/blood relations $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the biological/full/genetic-familial/'blood' parent of $x_2$; $x_2$ is the biological offspring/direct and immediate genetic-familial descendant of $x_1$.
rows.n: Step-parents are excluded, as are most other forms of parenting/rearing/raising/mentoring. Genetic clones may be included.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' descendant of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.
rows.n: $x_1$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_2$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_2$; trivially, one may consider $x_2$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_2$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazdze}".

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is genetic-familial/'blood' cousin to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; [non-immediate family member, default same generation (zero-times removed)].
rows.n: $x_1$ and $x_2$ share at least one common {ginlazdze}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a genetic-familial/biological/'blood' sibling of $x_2$ by bond/tie/standard/shared genetic parent(s) $x_3$.
rows.n: Half-siblings are included; step-siblings are excluded.

rows.d: $s_1$ is a chemical base (adenine/thymine/guanine/cytosine) within gene $j_1$=$s_2$.
$x_1$ is an instance of DNA/deoxyribonucleic acid (individual or mass) with purity $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a genetic/biological ancestor (or familial peer thereof) of $x_2$ by relationship/to degree $x_3$ through/along graph-geodesic within their shared biological family.
rows.n: There is a genetic/biological path of parent-child connections which connects $x_2$ to a familial peer of $x_1$ such that this said peer and $x_1$ are approximately of the same generation (such as siblings or cousins); $x_1$ must belong to the same genetic family as $x_2$ and the said peer. Very similar to "{rirny'utka}", except genetic/biological connection is implied every step along the way, and $x_1$ may actually be a familial peer of the same generation as the actual direct ancestor, rather than necessarily being that direct ancestor themself. Notice that any familial peer of $x_2$ is a potential substitute themself for $x_2$ in this definition, so a symmetry wrt the breadth of specification due to allowance of peers is indeed implied, but need be explicitly allowed by the definition in only one case. This word is broader than and includes {ginlazdze}; it allows for the possibility of horizontal gene transfer, artificial genetic manipulation, clonal relations, very large organisms (such as certain fungi and aspens) which appear to be multiple organisms, asexual reproduction, and possibly even tissue transplants (not all of which "{ginlazdze}" will include).

rows.d: $x_1$=$v_1$ is an event/state/act of sexual violence.
$g_1$=$b_1$ is the English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$ge_1$ is English grammar for structure/text $ge_2$.
$g_1$=$b_1$ is the British English language, used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$gu_1$ is England (country).
$x_1$ is an England of peoples $x_2$ with territory $x_3$, being English in aspect $x_4$.
$x_1$ is an English person / is a person that shows traits $x_2$ related to England / English culture.
$x_1$=$g_1$ is Anglican in aspect $x_2$=$g_2$.
$s_2$=$p_1$=$g_1$ is a hand-puppet operated by $s_1$ from material $g_2$

$x_1$ (node in graph) is near $x_2$ (node in same connected graph component), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) $x_3$ (default: at least one pairwise graph geodesic, with no restriction on which paths are considered) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$.
rows.n: $x_1$ need not be distinct from $x_2$, but they must share a connected graph component (undefined otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists). See also: "{toryrailu'a}".

rows.d: $x_1$ (node in graph) is among the very nearest nodes to $x_2$ (node in same graph), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) or paths of type $x_3$ (default: directed graph geodesics from $x_2$ to candidate other nodes, such that each of these candidates (plus $x_1$) are pairwise distinct from $x_2$) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$, the extreme $x_7$ (default: ka zmadu, implying most-near) being amongst set/range $x_8$ of candidate nodes.
rows.n: Multiple nodes may be equally near to $x_2$ for a given geodesic distance; $x_1$ is such that the geodesic distance between it and $x_2$ is positive but otherwise minimal (however, this does not necessarily uniquely specify/define/designate $x_1$). $x_1$, $x_2$, and elements of/nodes in $x_3$, $x_5$, and $x_8$ must all share a single edge-connected graph component, namely $x_5$; this word's referent is undefined/errors out otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists. Path type for $x_3$ should define/be defined by a restrictive characteristic. Default value of $x_7$ is "ka zmadu", meaning "the quality of being most-near to $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.", as opposed to (for example) "ka mleca", which means "the quality of being the least-near/most-far from $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.". $x_1$ and $x_2$ each are a candidate node for the purposes of this definition. The condition of pairwise distinctness between candidates from $x_2$ may be relaxed by specification of or removal of definitional default for $x_3$. See also: "{toryrailu'a}", "{grafyjbi}".

rows.d: $g_1$=$j_2$=$f_2$ is a singularity/black hole with point-like gravity well $f_4$=$j_1$ with mass of $g_2$ kilograms.
$b_1$ ferries $b_2$=$p_1$ to $b_3$=$p_3$ from $b_4$=$p_4$ over barrier/medium/portal $b_5$=$p_2$.
$b_1$ is a ferry boat for carrying $b_2$ over barrier/medium/portal $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin $x_5$=$p_4$.
$g_1$ makes $x_2$=$p_1$ pass through $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin side $x_5$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a hole in $x_2$=$k_2$=$p_2$ to/between $x_3$=$p_3$ from/and $x_4$=$p_4$ permitting passage by $x_5$=$p_1$.
rows.n: {pagre} + {kevna}. Precisely, $x_2$ is the barrier, $x_3$ is the inside, and $x_4$ is the outside, if distinguishable; loosely, $x_2$ might be given as the object consisting of both the barrier and the inside.

rows.d: $x_1$=$p_1$=$k_1$ passes through portal/generically exits or enters via portal (entrance/exit) $x_2$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_3$=$p_3$=$k_2$ from origin side $x_4$=$p_4$=$k_3$ via route $x_5$=$k_4$ using means/vehicle $x_6$=$k_5$.
rows.n: $x_5$, in its fullest possible description, must include $x_2$. This word emphasises movement or transportation, usually unidirectional for any given $x_1$ at any given time (not simultaneously bidirectional nor back-and-forth). It is meant to be a generic form of "{nerkla}" and "{barkla}", and is intended to approximate/analogize/extend their veljvo compositions. Aside from the aforementioned emphasis and intent, as well as the terbri, it is quite similar to "{pagre}" itself, although their might be further slight connotational differences (such as the means of passage through the barrier and the type of barrier involved, whether being able to remain on both sides of the barrier statically is within scope of definition (it might be for "pagre" but is not for this word, at least to any significant extent), etc.). $x_2$ is an exit or entrance when generic terminology is desired; a generic word for a portal or doorway (see: "{vorme}") technically is always equivalent, so long as the portal is open and functional, but we often conceptualize exits and entrances (whether unidirectional or bidirectional according to their designs) as being to or from the overall structure (such as a house or vehicle) and not merely internal to it (such as a bedroom or bathroom doorway in a house), and this word is intended to capture this implication more explicitly.

rows.d: $s_2$ is the anthem of $g_1$.
$p_1$ is a subset of $g_1$.
$x_1$ is the product (combined multiplication result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$)
$x_1$ is the sum (combined addition result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$)

$x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/e^{(x_3)}$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $e$ is the natural exponential base and $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the one-$(e^{(x_3)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) $(x_3)$-th one-e-th-ing/e-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).
rows.n: The experimental gismu {tezda} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (default sense) but also to doubling time (if $x_3$ is filled by $-1$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.

rows.d: $x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately half according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_3$; $x_1$ is the half-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) halving of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (dimensionful number: time).
rows.n: Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). See also: {gritezdybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.

rows.d: $x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/(x_3)$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a positive real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the $(x_3^{(-1)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) one-$x_3$-th-ing/$(x_3)$-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).
rows.n: The experimental gismu {xonba} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri of this word can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $2$) but also to doubling time (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $1/2$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {gritezdybi'otei}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a frustum/cone/cylinder/pyramid made of material $x_2$ with larger base $x_3$ and at-most-as-large base $x_4$, with other characteristics $x_5$.
rows.n: $x_4$ cannot be larger in hyperarea than $x_3$. A cone and a pyramid are degenerate frusta with exactly one base ($x_4$) being exactly a point (the apex); a line segment is a doubly-degenerate frustum with $x_3$ (and therefore $x_4$) being a point. The bases should typically be approximately parallel to one another; they need not be perpendicular to their axis. Except possibly when at least one base is a point, they will be (apprpximately) geometrically similar to one another (having the same cross-section along parallel planes wrt the axis, modulo scale/size, which will nonetheless be multiplied by a uniform factor in all 'dimensions'). A round base will produce, approximately, a circular cone or a (circular) cylinder.

rows.n: Inner structure of the rule: operator-1 (joik-jek operator-1 | joik stag? KE # operator /KEhE#/)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (plural of ordered pairs) is an exhaustive set (possibly infinite) of inputs/outputs defining a unary function which yields result $x_3$ when given input $x_2$; $x_1$($x_2$) = $x_3$
rows.n: "f(x) = z" == "fy funtiio xy fi zy". "lo ro se {zilbri} be lo ka ce'u {sumji} ce'u li pa" is a way to extract the input/output set of the relation "f(x) = x1", so that you can use it as funtiio's x1. Using a la-name for referring to a function is also an option, for example "la .fankcyn. cu funtiio li re li ci". See also {fancu}, {fancuka}.

$x_1$ rusts
